intro: Pagaea pumila, commonly known as the dwarf sea holly, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves and small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in maritime environments. Pagaea pumila is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to tolerate salt spray and coastal conditions.
